intro: Imhofia corusca, commonly known as the golden torch ginger, is a striking tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, red-bracted inflorescences that resemble torches. Its flowers are followed by clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are often used in floral arrangements. Imhofia corusca thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
